claim: Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain vs 15 mcg of HA per strain in a standard-dose influenza vaccine.

verified_snippets.quote: For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains: A/West Virginia 30 2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm 09 like virus) (H1 N1), A/Massachusetts/18/ 2022 (H3 N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
verified_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that Flublok contains 45 mcg of hemagglutinin (HA) per strain, supporting the first part of the claim.
verified_snippets.actual_text: For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains: A/West Virginia 30 2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm 09 like virus) (H1 N1), A/Massachusetts/18/ 2022 (H3 N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.

verified_snippets.quote: Flublok is standardized according to United States Public Health Service (USPHS) requirements.
verified_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote, while not giving a specific number, supports that Flublok's HA content is set according to official standards, which are referenced in the claim.
verified_snippets.actual_text: Flublok is standardized according to United States Public Health Service (USPHS) requirements.

verified_snippets.quote: Data from a randomized, controlled trial demonstrated that children 6 months to less than 3 years of age had diminished hemagglutinin inhibition (HI) responses to Flublok compared to a U.S.-licensed influenza vaccine approved for use in this population, strongly suggesting that Flublok would not be effective in children younger than 3 years of age (6).
verified_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote references a comparison to a standard U.S.-licensed influenza vaccine, which typically contains 15 mcg HA per strain, indirectly supporting the claim by establishing the comparator.
verified_snippets.actual_text: Data froma randomized, controlled trial demonstrated that children 6 months to less than 3 years of age had diminished hemagglutinin inhibition (HI) responses to Flublok compared to au. S.-licensedinfluenza vaccine approved for usein this population, strongly suggesting that Flublok would not be effective in children younger than3 years of age (6).
differences: Spacing differences: 'Data froma' vs 'Data from a', 'to au. S.-licensedinfluenza vaccine approved for usein this population' vs 'to a U.S.-licensed influenza vaccine approved for use in this population', 'than3 years' vs 'than 3 years'
Minor typographical errors: 'au. S.-licensedinfluenza' instead of 'a U.S.-licensed influenza', 'usein' instead of 'use in', 'younger than3' instead of 'younger than 3'
No significant punctuation or ligature differences affecting meaning
